node.title: Max has made a career of repairing iPhones on TikTok â€” and now you could join him
node.alt: A white man with long brown hair sits in a chair, alongside an image of the insides of an iPhone
node.description: Max Hawker repairs iPhones on TikTok for a living, but thanks to a backflip from technology giant Apple, everyday Australians might soon be able to fix them themselves.
node.content:
["Max\u00a0Hawker has fixed himself a career out of broken technology.", "He used to work in\u00a0a phone store, and\u00a0began helping people\u00a0with technology issues in his spare time after seeing \"a pretty big need\" from customers.", "Now aged 29 and based in Queensland's Whitsundays region, he's\u00a0been an independent electronics repairman for six years.", "He's also a big name on social media platform TikTok, where videos of him enthusiastically\u00a0fixing issues with people's damaged devices have received more than 5.5 million likes.", "From his attention-grabbing greeting \"What's diggin'?\" to his classic sign-off \"All in a day's work, mate\", his cheerful clips have seen him amass 450,000 followers in the past 14 months.", "Mr Hawker says he is used to receiving questions from followers about how they can fix their own devices, and now they're asking him why Apple has reversed its long-held stance of preventing iPhone owners from doing just that.", "\"I think it's a pretty big backflip,\" he said.", "\"There's not really a manufacturer out there that I know of that is pro-repair ... If it's more than a screen or a battery, they essentially want you to buy a new device and replace it.\"", "", "
Max Hawker says people often ask him about repairing their own devices(Supplied: Max Hawker)
", "
So what did\u00a0Apple announce?
", "Last month Apple said it would launch a Self Service Repair program in 2022, to allow customers to buy official parts, tools and manuals so they can repair their own devices.", "It's a major shift for a company which is notoriously protective of its intellectual property, and \u2013 like many other tech companies \u2013 has been accused of designing products which are difficult to repair without special equipment.", "Apple said its new program will begin in the United States early next year\u00a0and \"expand to additional countries throughout 2022\".", "The program will initially include parts such as screens, batteries and cameras for some of the latest iPhone models, but will later include more parts for iPhones and for some Mac computers.", "
Why has Apple backflipped?
", "Griffith University law professor Leanne Wiseman\u00a0says Apple's decision is a sign that regulators are paying attention to the right to repair movement, which continues to grow in Australia.", "She says technology companies often cite issues with intellectual property as well as customer safety, security and privacy as reasons against allowing people to make their own repairs, but legislative pressure and the potential to make money while controlling more of the repair market may have influenced Apple's thinking.", "\"It is a complete backflip, which is really exciting,\" Professor Wiseman said.", "\"It's really the wind beneath the sails of the right to repair movement now, because if Apple can say that you can fix things, then hopefully that will just show other manufacturers that there's no safety or security concerns as well.\"", "In the US, about\u00a0half the states\u00a0have considered\u00a0right to repair legislation this year, and President Joe Biden signed an executive order in July calling on his country's Federal Trade Commission to crack down on \"unfair anticompetitive restrictions on third-party repair or self-repair of items\".", "Some Apple shareholders reportedly believe the company's change of heart was also influenced by a key deadline in their request that Apple re-evaluate its stance on independent repair, The Verge reported.", "", "
Griffith University\u00a0professor Leanne Wiseman\u00a0hopes Apple's decision will lead to positive industry change(ABC News: Rosie King)
", "
What's been the response to Apple's announcement?
", "Apple's backflip has been a pleasant surprise for the right to repair movement and many in the technology industry, but others are wary of things like cost and the risks of letting untrained consumers do their own repairs.", "Kyle Wiens, the CEO of iFixit \u2013 which independently sells parts and creates repair guides for many Apple devices \u2013 shared his views on social media shortly after Apple's announcement.", "\"This one announcement doesn't undo years of harm that Apple's design practices, undermining of environmental standards, and cynical lobbying have done. The industry is on a dark path of obsolescence right now,\" Mr Wiens said.", "\"But there is hope. Today is a good day. Let's join together, push back entropy, and help other companies on this journey.\"", "Apple is yet to release pricing for its Self Service Repair program, but many in the industry don't expect it to be cheaper to fix your iPhone yourself than to take it into Apple or an approved repairer.", "Some see the program as a next step to keeping more electronic devices out of landfill and slowing the increase in e-waste, which has surged in 2021 and is expected to reach over 70 million tonnes globally per year by 2030.", "\"We all probably know how many broken phones we've got in our drawers at home, and all of the valuable minerals and materials that are in an iPhone,\" Professor Wiseman said.", "\"So it's not only saving e-waste, but it's also stopping those things being sourced and manufactured in the first place.\"", "Others, like independent repairer Max Hawker, see the Self Service Repair program as more of a public relations move.", "\"I do believe it's more an optics play than anything, but I will happily be proven wrong,\"\u00a0Mr Hawker said.", "\"I hope when we actually see this roll out and how it all goes down \u2013 if more and more parts and more and more manuals become available, that would be awesome. I just don't think it's going to go down like that.\"", "
Can I really do repairs myself?
", "Apple has acknowledged its Self Service Repair program isn't designed for most consumers, but rather for those \"with the knowledge and experience to repair electronic devices\".", "", "
Max Hawker said inexperienced consumers would make errors when repairing their own devices(Supplied: Max Hawker)
", "Mr Hawker said while he didn't want to scare anyone, it was inevitable that inexperienced consumers who tried to repair things themselves would make errors.", "\"Once you look at the prices, and then people take the risk on board, I'd be very surprised if a high volume of people take this on board and start doing repairs themselves,\" he said.", "
Will Apple's backflip change the industry for better?
", "In its announcement last month, Apple said it is \"designing products for durability, longevity and increased repairability\".", "iFixit's Mr Wiens is optimistic that a financial incentive to increase repairability and sell parts to customers may change the way Apple and other tech companies design their products.", "And Professor Wiseman believes other technology companies may follow in Apple's footsteps, as they have in the past.", "\"I think it's likely in the future that we'll see other tech providers follow suit and provide at least access to their repair information and service information, and hopefully some spare parts,\" she said.", "", "
Apple said Self Service Repair isn't intended for the majority of its customers(Supplied: Apple)
", "
What is Australia doing about the right to repair?
", "Australia's Productivity Commission has been examining the right to repair this year.", "In\u00a0a report handed to the federal government in October and released publicly on December 1, the Commission found it is difficult for independent repairers to access spare parts, tools or information needed to repair everyday items, making it harder and more costly for consumers to get things fixed.", "The report found that while Australian consumers already have \"reasonably comprehensive\" rights, improvements could be made such as\u00a0amending copyright laws to allow repair information to be shared more easily.", "The Commission\u00a0recommended the federal government\u00a0force manufacturers to provide software updates for \"a reasonable time period\", as well as\u00a0more clarity\u00a0around warranties and entitlements so customers are\u00a0aware of their rights.", "It also recommended the introduction of\u00a0a product labelling scheme informing\u00a0consumers about the repairability or durability of products,\u00a0which had\u00a0also been proposed by consumer group CHOICE.", "\"The Productivity Commission has done a fantastic job, and we just hope that the federal government takes some of these recommendations up,\"\u00a0Professor Wiseman said.", "Mr Hawker agrees there is still more work to be done. \"I think we've got so much more ground to gain, and that goes with every device,\" he said.", "\"If you can't modify or repair a product you buy, is it really yours at the end of the day?\""]
